intro: Jatropha tubulosa var. triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and opposite, trifoliate leaves with three rounded lobes. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by orange-red, fleshy fruits. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. The species is part of the Euphorbiaceae family, known for its milky sap and diverse ecological roles.
